dialog: Aye, I can.
Additionally, I would like two copies of each of the spell-stills.
Do tell me about yourself, if you please.
My name is Dunlin and I hail from Beijing. I was born in the year of the dragon, 1980. I shall be graduating from Peking University this July, with a specialization in the art of accounting.
Might you also share some details about your kin?
I come from a small family of three, myself, my father who is a professor of magic, and my mother who is a skilled artisan.
It is high time I start nourishing myself with wholesome ingredients.
Aye, 'tis true. I too must start making better choices in my meals.
What manner of food do you typically partake in?
I do my utmost to only consume fruits, vegetables, and lean cuts of enchanted chicken.
Is that truly all that goes into your cauldron?
Indeed, for the most part.
How do you manage to stick to such a limited diet?
Fruits, vegetables, and magical creatures such as chicken, are known to be highly nutritious and beneficial to the body and soul.
Aye, but what of the enchanted chicken?
I mostly consume baked chicken, as it is prepared in a manner that retains its nutritional properties and is relatively low in unhealthy substances.
That does sound rather palatable.
Indeed it does, for it is both wholesome and satisfying.
Good day to you! Might I be of assistance?
Would you be so kind as to direct me to the aisle housing the robes of the Chinese persuasion? I am in search of a silken cloak.
